storyTitle: As System Auditor, I want to review audit trails of attendance data changes to ensure compliance

testCases.title: Review audit logs for attendance data changes
preconditions: System auditor account exists with valid credentials
Audit log database contains attendance data change records
Audit portal is accessible and operational
Test data includes attendance changes by multiple users across different dates
Export functionality is configured and enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the audit portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Audit portal login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid system auditor credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Access granted to audit log interface, auditor dashboard is displayed with search and filter options

steps.action: Verify audit log interface displays available search criteria including user, date, action type, and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Search interface shows all filter options with appropriate input fields and date pickers

steps.action: Enter specific user name in the user filter field
steps.expectedResult: User filter accepts the input and displays matching suggestions if available

steps.action: Select a date range using the date filter (e.g., last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed in the filter criteria

steps.action: Click Search or Apply Filters button
steps.expectedResult: Relevant audit records are displayed in a table format showing user identity, timestamp, action type (create/update/delete), and change details

steps.action: Review the displayed audit records for completeness including all required fields
steps.expectedResult: Each audit record contains user name, exact timestamp, action performed, before/after values, and affected attendance record ID

steps.action: Click on Export button and select export format (CSV or PDF)
steps.expectedResult: Export format selection dialog appears with available format options

steps.action: Select CSV format and confirm export
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs are exported successfully, download begins, and file contains all filtered records with proper formatting

steps.action: Open the exported file and verify data integrity
steps.expectedResult: Exported file opens correctly and contains all audit log data matching the displayed records

postconditions: Auditor remains logged into the audit portal
Audit logs remain unchanged and intact
Exported file is saved to local system
Audit trail of the export action is recorded in the system

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized access to audit logs
preconditions: Non-auditor user account exists with valid credentials (e.g., regular employee or attendance manager)
Role-based access control is configured and enforced
Audit portal URL is known and accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the audit portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Audit portal login page is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid non-auditor user credentials (e.g., regular employee username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted for authentication

steps.action: Click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Access to audit logs is denied with appropriate error message such as 'Access Denied: Insufficient Permissions' or 'You do not have authorization to view audit logs'

steps.action: Verify user is not redirected to audit log interface
steps.expectedResult: User remains on login page or is redirected to an error page, audit log interface is not accessible

steps.action: Attempt to access audit log URL directly by typing the endpoint URL in browser
steps.expectedResult: Access is blocked with 403 Forbidden error or redirect to unauthorized access page

steps.action: Verify no audit log data is visible or accessible through any interface
steps.expectedResult: No audit records, search functionality, or export options are displayed to the unauthorized user

postconditions: Non-auditor user remains unauthorized to access audit logs
Failed access attempt is logged in security audit trail
No audit data has been exposed or compromised

storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to view real-time attendance status to monitor workforce presence

testCases.title: View real-time attendance status with filtering
preconditions: Attendance manager account exists with valid credentials and appropriate role permissions
Real-time attendance dashboard is deployed and operational
Real-time attendance database contains current employee attendance data
Multiple employees have checked in using biometric and manual methods
Employees belong to different departments and shifts
Auto-refresh functionality is configured to update every minute

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance management system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid attendance manager credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Access granted to real-time dashboard, dashboard loads displaying current attendance status for all employees

steps.action: Verify dashboard displays employee list with attendance status including employee name, check-in time, status (present/absent/late), and attendance source (biometric/manual)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows comprehensive attendance information in a clear table or card layout with all required fields visible

steps.action: Observe the visual indicators for absent and late employees
steps.expectedResult: Absent employees are highlighted with distinct color (e.g., red) and late employees are highlighted with another color (e.g., yellow or orange)

steps.action: Verify biometric and manual attendance entries are differentiated with icons or labels
steps.expectedResult: Each attendance entry clearly shows the source with appropriate icon or text label (e.g., fingerprint icon for biometric, manual entry icon for manual)

steps.action: Locate and click on the department filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Department filter dropdown expands showing list of all available departments

steps.action: Select a specific department from the dropdown (e.g., 'IT Department')
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates immediately to show only employees from the selected department, employee count reflects filtered results

steps.action: Verify filtered results display only employees from the selected department
steps.expectedResult: All displayed employees belong to the selected department, other department employees are hidden

steps.action: Clear department filter and apply shift filter by selecting a specific shift (e.g., 'Morning Shift')
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates to show only employees assigned to the selected shift

steps.action: Note the current timestamp displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows last refresh timestamp clearly visible

steps.action: Wait for 60 seconds without any user interaction
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes after 1 minute, last refresh timestamp updates to current time

steps.action: Verify attendance status data has been updated with any new check-ins or status changes
steps.expectedResult: Attendance status reflects the most current data, any new check-ins appear in the list, status indicators update if employees arrived late

steps.action: Observe the refresh indicator or animation during auto-refresh
steps.expectedResult: Visual feedback is provided during refresh (e.g., loading spinner or refresh icon animation)

postconditions: Manager remains logged into the attendance dashboard
Dashboard continues to auto-refresh every minute
Applied filters remain active unless cleared by user
Real-time attendance data remains accurate and up-to-date
Manager's dashboard access is logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to real-time dashboard
preconditions: Unauthorized user account exists with valid credentials but without attendance manager role (e.g., regular employee or contractor)
Role-based access control is properly configured

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance management system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid credentials for an unauthorized user (non-manager role)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted for authentication

steps.action: Click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Access to real-time attendance dashboard is denied, error message is displayed such as 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view the attendance dashboard' or 'Unauthorized Access'

steps.action: Verify user is not redirected to the real-time dashboard interface
steps.expectedResult: User is either kept on login page with error message or redirected to their appropriate home page without dashboard access

steps.action: Attempt to access the dashboard directly by entering the dashboard URL in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is blocked with HTTP 403 Forbidden error or redirect to unauthorized access page

steps.action: Verify no attendance data, filters, or dashboard features are visible
steps.expectedResult: No employee attendance information, department filters, shift filters, or real-time status data is displayed to the unauthorized user

steps.action: Check if any API endpoints can be accessed directly through browser developer tools or API testing tools
steps.expectedResult: API endpoint GET /api/attendance/real-time returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized error when accessed without proper authorization

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains blocked from accessing the dashboard
No attendance data has been exposed to unauthorized user
Failed access attempt is logged in security audit trail
Dashboard security and access controls remain intact
User can only access features appropriate to their assigned role
